englishExplanation: May mukundA, with the discuss, mace, conch and lotus in His hands, purify us- mukundA who is seated on a seat of garlands of pearls, in the region of the milky ocean with the sand shining by the light from pure gems; who is adorned by pearls transparent like crystals; and who is enjoying ecstatic bliss on account of pure white clouds overhead, raining showers of nectar.
englishShloka:
Ksheerodanvath Pradese Suchimani Vilasath Saikathe Maukthikanam,
 Malaklupthasanastha Spatikamani Nibhai Maukthikai Mandithangah |
 Shubrai-Rabrai-Rathabrai Ruparivirachitai Muktha Peeyusha Varshai Anandi Na
 Puniyadari Nalina Gadha Sankapanir Mukundaha || 1 ||
kannadaShloka:
ಕ್ಷೀರೋದನ್ವತ್ಪ್ರದೇಶೇ ಶುಚಿಮಣಿವಿಲಸತ್ಸೈಕತೇ ಮೌಕ್ತಿಕಾನಾಂ
 ಮಾಲಾಕ್ಲೃಪ್ತಾಸನಸ್ಥಃ ಸ್ಫಟಿಕಮಣಿನಿಭೈರ್ಮೌಕ್ತಿಕೈರ್ಮಂಡಿತಾಂಗ: |
 ಶುಭ್ರೈರಭ್ರೈರದಭ್ರೈರುಪರಿವಿರಚಿತೈರ್ಮುಕ್ತಪೀಯೂಷವರ್ಷೈಃ
 ಆನಂದೀ ನಃ ಪುನೀಯಾದರಿನಳಿನಗದಾಶಂಖಪಾಣಿರ್ಮುಕುಂದಃ ||
sanskritShloka:
क्षीरोद्न्वत्प्रदेशे शुचिमणिविलसत्सैकतेमौक्तिकानां मालाकॣप्तासनस्थ:
 स्पटिकमनिनिभैमौक्तिकैमण्डिताङ्ग्:।
 सुभ्रैरभ्रैरदभ्रैरुपरिविरचितैर्मुक्तपीयूष वर्षै: आनन्दी न: पुनीयादरिनलिनगद
 शङ्खपाणिर्मुकुन्द:॥ १ ॥
title: Dhyanam

englishExplanation: I bow to Lord vishNu who has the three worlds as His body. The Earth is His feet, and the sky His navel. Wind is His breath, and the Sun and the Moon are His eyes. Directions are His ears, and the Heaven is His head. Fire is His face and ocean His abdomen. In Him is situated the universe with diverse kinds of Gods, men, birds, cattle, serpents, gandharvas and daityas (demons)- all sporting in a charming way.
englishShloka:
Bhoo Padau Yasya Nabhi R Viyadasu Ranila Schandra Suryaau Cha Nethre, Karnavasa
 shiro Dhau mukhamapi Dahano Yasya Vasteyamabhdhi |
 Anthastham Yasya Viswam Sura Nara Khaga Go Bhogi Gandharva Dhaityai, Chitram Ram
 Ramyathe Tham Thribhuvana Vapusham Vishnumeesam Namami || 2 ||
kannadaShloka:
ಭೂಃ ಪಾದೌ ಯಸ್ಯ ನಾಭಿರ್ವಿಯದಸುರನಿಲಶ್ಚಂದ್ರಸೂರ್ಯೌ ಚ ನೇತ್ರೇ
 ಕರ್ಣಾವಾಶಾಃ ಶಿರೋ ದ್ಯೌರ್ಮುಖಮಪಿ ದಹನೋ ಯಸ್ಯ ವಾಸ್ತೇಯಮಬ್ಧಿಃ |

 ಅಂತಃಸ್ಥಂ ಯಸ್ಯ ವಿಶ್ವಂ ಸುರನರಖಗಗೋ ಭೋಗಿಗಂಧರ್ವದೈತ್ಯೈಃ
 ಚಿತ್ರಂ ರಂರಮ್ಯತೇ ತಂ ತ್ರಿಭುವನವಪುಷಂ ವಿಷ್ಣುಮೀಶಂ ನಮಾಮಿ ||
sanskritShloka:
भू: पादौ यस्य नाभिवियद्सुरनिलस्श्चन्द्र सुर्यौ च नेत्रे कर्णावाशा: शिरो धौ
 मुखमपि दहनो यस्य वस्तेयमब्धि:।
 अन्त:स्थं यस्य विश्व्ं सुरनरखगगोभोगिगन्धर्वदैत्यै: चित्रं रंरम्यते तं त्रिभुवन वपुषं
 विष्णुमीशं नमामि ॥ २ ॥
title: Dhyanam

englishExplanation: I salute vishNu, the sole master of the universe, whose presence is very peaceful, who stretches Himself on a serpent-bed (Adi-Sesha), who sports a lotus in His navel, who is one lord of all the devAs, who is the support of the worlds, who is subtle and All-pervading like the sky, whose complexion is like that of the clouds, whose form is very beautiful, who is the consort of Sri, whose eyes are like lotus petals, who is meditated upon by Yogis and who eradicates the fear of samsAra
englishShloka:
Om Namo Bhagavate Vasudevaya |
 Shanthakaram Bujaga Shayanam Padmanabham Suresam, Viswadharam Gagana sadrusam Megha
 Varnam Shubangam |
 Lakshmi Kantham Kamala Nayanam Yogi Hrid Dhyana Gamyam, Vande Vishnum Bhava
 Bhayaharam Sarva Lokaika Natham || 3 ||
kannadaShloka:
ಓಂ ನಮೋ ಭಗವತೇ ವಾಸುದೇವಾಯ |

 ಶಾಂತಾಕಾರಂ ಭುಜಗಶಯನಂ ಪದ್ಮನಾಭಂ ಸುರೇಶಂ
 ವಿಶ್ವಾಧಾರಂ ಗಗನಸದೃಶಂ ಮೇಘವರ್ಣಂ ಶುಭಾಂಗಮ್ |
 ಲಕ್ಷ್ಮೀಕಾಂತಂ ಕಮಲನಯನಂ ಯೋಗಿಹೃದ್ಧ್ಯಾನಗಮ್ಯಂ
 ವಂದೇ ವಿಷ್ಣುಂ ಭವಭಯಹರಂ ಸರ್ವಲೋಕೈಕನಾಥಮ್ ||
sanskritShloka:
ॐ नमो भगवते वसुदेवाय।
 शान्तकारं भुजगशयनं पद्मनाभं सुरेशं विश्वाधरं गगनसद्रुशं मेघवर्णं शुभङ्गम्।
 लक्श्मिकन्तं कमलनयनं योगि ह्रुध्यानगम्यं वन्दे विष्णुं भवभयहरं सर्वलोकैकनाथम् ॥ ३ ॥
title: Dhyanam

englishExplanation: I prostrate before vishNu, the one Lord of the worlds, blue as the cloud and clothed in yellow robes. His chest is marked by the mole known as srivatsa. His body is resplendent with kaustubha gem. He is surrounded by holy persons. And he has wide eyes like lotuses
englishShloka:
Megha Shyamam Peetha Kouseya Vasam Srivatsaankam Kausthuboth Bhasithangam |
 Punyopetham Pundareekayathaksham Vishnum Vande Sarva Lokaika Natham || 4 ||
kannadaShloka:
ಮೇಘಶ್ಯಾಮಂ ಪೀತಕೌಶೇಯವಾಸಂ
 ಶ್ರೀವತ್ಸಾಂಕಂ ಕೌಸ್ತುಭೋದ್ಭಾಸಿತಾಂಗಮ್ |
 ಪುಣ್ಯೋಪೇತಂ ಪುಂಡರೀಕಾಯತಾಕ್ಷಂ
 ವಿಷ್ಣುಂ ವಂದೇ ಸರ್ವಲೋಕೈಕನಾಥಮ್ ||
sanskritShloka:
मेघश्यां पीतकौशेयवासं श्रीवत्साङ्कं कौस्थुभोद्भासिताङ्गम्।
 पुन्योपेतं पुन्डरीकायताक्षं विष्णुं वन्दे सर्वलोकैकनाथम् ॥ ४ ॥
title: Dhyanam

englishExplanation: I bow down my head before the four-handed vishNu who sports in His hand the Sankha and the discuss, who is adorned with a crown and ear-pendants, who wears a yellow cloth, whose eyes resemble a lotus and whose chest is beautified by many necklaces and the kaustubha mark.
englishShloka:
Sashanka Chakram Sakirita Kundalam Sapeethavastram Saraseeruhekshanam |
 Sahara Vaksha Sthala Shobhi Kousthubham Namaami Vishnum Shirasa Chaturbhujam || 5 ||
kannadaShloka:
ಸಶಂಖಚಕ್ರಂ ಸಕಿರೀಟಕುಂಡಲಂ
 ಸಪೀತವಸ್ತ್ರಂ ಸರಸೀರುಹೇಕ್ಷಣಮ್ |
 ಸಹಾರವಕ್ಷಃಸ್ಥಲಶೋಭಿಕೌಸ್ತುಭಂ
 ನಮಾಮಿ ವಿಷ್ಣುಂ ಶಿರಸಾ ಚತುರ್ಭುಜಮ್ ||
sanskritShloka:
सशङ्खचक्रं सकिरिटकुण्डलं सपीतवस्त्रं सरसीरुहेक्षणम्।
 सहारवक्ष्:स्थलकौस्तुभक्ष्रियं नमामि विष्णुं सिरसा चथुर्भुजम्॥५॥
title: Dhyanam

englishExplanation: I seek refuge in Lord Krishna, Who is with Rukhmani and Satyabhama, Who sits on a golden throne, In the shade of Parijata tree, Who is of the colour of the black cloud, Who has long broad eyes, Who has a face like moon, Who has four hands,And who has a chest adorned by Sreevatsa.
englishShloka:
Chayayam Parijatasya Hemasimhasanopari,
 Aseenamam Budha Shyama Mayathakshamalankrutham |
 Chandrananam Chathurbahum Sreevatsankitha Vakshasam,
 Rukmani Satyabhamabhyam Sahitham Krishnamasraye || 6 ||
kannadaShloka:
ಛಾಯಾಯಾಂ ಪಾರಿಜಾತಸ್ಯ ಹೇಮಸಿಂಹಾಸನೋಪರಿ |
 ಆಸೀನಮಂಬುದಶ್ಯಾಮಮಾಯತಾಕ್ಷಮಲಂಕೃತಮ್ ||
 ಚಂದ್ರಾನನಂ ಚತುರ್ಬಾಹುಂ ಶ್ರೀವತ್ಸಾಂಕಿತವಕ್ಷಸಮ್ |
 ರುಕ್ಮಿಣೀಸತ್ಯಭಾಮಾಭ್ಯಾಂ ಸಹಿತಂ ಕೃಷ್ಣಮಾಶ್ರಯೇ ||
sanskritShloka:
छायायां पारिजातस्य हेमसिंहासनोपरि आसिनमम्बुदश्याममायताक्षमलंक्रुतम्।
 चन्द्राननं चतुर्बाहुं श्रीवत्साङ्कित वक्षसं रुक्मिणी सत्यभामाभ्यां सहितं
 क्रुष्णमाक्ष्रये ॥ ६ ॥
title: Dhyanam
